msContents.summary: Receipt issued to a certain Harpalus, son of Apion, grandson of Herm( ), his mother being Sambathis, for the payment of poll tax.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: This medium-brown papyrus is completely preserved. It is slightly darker on the left half due to a moderate concentration of existing crystals of sand and caked dirt. There are three vertical breaks in the papyrus, the area within each diminishing in width from left to right - 3 3/4 to 3 1/4 to 2 1/2 cm. This may indicate its condition when found - rolled and flattened. There are a few small wormholes, mostly yo blank areas. However, there are three lacunas to the right of the center break, in line 5, which interfere somewhat, enough ink remaining for reasonable reading.

handDesc.p: The scribe used an extremely rapid cursive typical of the nature of the document which is an excellent example of "Verschleifung". Hardly a word conforms to adopted palaeographical norms. In part, the hand resembles the following: P. Lond. III 912b (?147 A.D. - no transcription given), P. Mert. I 21 (188 A.D.) and plates 1 & 2 of D. H. Samuel, BASP 14, 1977, facing p. 142. The ink is dark and clear where the papyrus is intact. There is a margin of approximately 1 cm. at both the top and the left side. Beneath the last line there are 2 cm. blank.

div.ab: "The second year of Antoninus and Verus, the lords Augusti Armeniaci Medici Parthici Maximi, Epeiph 25, account of Pharmouthi (or Pauni [?]), paid by Harpalus, son of Apion, grandson of Herm( ), his mother being Sambathis, as poll-tax of the second year for the Second Goose-farm Quarter, twenty drachmas, that is, 20, with payments of ten copper obols."
